intro: Cordylanthus capillaris, commonly known as the slender stickseed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Cordylanthus capillaris is often found in coastal and inland regions, thriving in well-drained soils.
